name: Shibuya Crossing
description: Often referred to as the world's busiest pedestrian crossing, Shibuya Crossing is a symbol of Tokyo's vibrant energy. It sees thousands of people crossing from all directions simultaneously, surrounded by massive video screens and neon advertisements.

name: Meiji Shrine (Meiji Jingu)
description: Nestled within a lush forest in the heart of Tokyo, Meiji Shrine is dedicated to Emperor Meiji and Empress Shōken. It offers a serene escape from the city's hustle with traditional Shinto architecture and tranquil paths.

name: Tsukiji Outer Market
address: 4 Chome-16-2 Tsukiji, Chuo City, Tokyo 104-0045, Japan
description: A bustling hub for fresh seafood, produce, and street food. Visitors can enjoy sushi, grilled seafood, and traditional Japanese snacks in this food paradise.

name: Akihabara
description: Known as Tokyo's 'Electric Town,' Akihabara is packed with electronics shops, gaming arcades, anime and manga stores, and themed cafés—a haven for tech and anime lovers.

name: teamLab Planets TOKYO
address: 6 Chome-1-16 Toyosu, Koto City, Tokyo 135-0061, Japan
description: An immersive digital art museum where visitors walk through water and interact with massive digital installations that blend art, technology, and nature.

name: Asakusa & Sensō-ji Temple
address: 2 Chome-3-1 Asakusa, Taito City, Tokyo 111-0032, Japan
description: Home to Tokyo's oldest Buddhist temple. The surrounding Asakusa area offers historic charm with traditional shops and local street food.

name: Odaiba
description: A futuristic man-made island featuring shopping malls, entertainment complexes, a life-sized Gundam statue, and beautiful views of Tokyo Bay.

name: Tokyo Skytree
address: 1 Chome-1-2 Oshiage, Sumida City, Tokyo 131-0045, Japan
description: The tallest structure in Japan with panoramic city views from observation decks, plus shopping, dining, and an aquarium.
